text: Can you elaborate on this? I've been using them for about 4 years and think their software is great compared to others I've used.

attachments.fallback: [July 30th, 2016 12:52 PM] mariogintili: but crunch has over 80 controls they expect you to learn
attachments.text: but crunch has over 80 controls they expect you to learn

text: I use Freeagent as it came “free” with my accountant
<@U043AB2QT>: maybe I’m using it the wrong way?
(IE it’s built into the retainer I pay them each month, so I pay for it through that)
I feel like the whole flow of uploading your statement and reconciling costs takes wayyyyy too long
it takes around 30secs to reconcile 1 payment
say I have 40 payments/week

<@U047GTU64>: I guess I've not really experienced any problem there. I don't have anywhere near that many things to reconcile.

Are you going to be able to get away from that though? Raising invoices, inputting expenses, reconciling payments coming into the bank account with the invoices/expenses.... These are just general things that need to happen when running na ltd.
Are those reconciliations mainly expenses?
<@U043AB2QT>: I clearly won’t but I’m trying to look for something with a simpler way of managing those
kinda like my pain point at the moment
so for example maybe xerox? orrr freeagent?
crunch has great customer support
I like that
but I see myself pinging them a bit too often
Fair enough...I expect though that you'll find you're going to need to do those sorts of things regardless of what software you use.
could be just me though
Keep me posted on what you find that solves your problems <@U047GTU64>. Interested to hear about it.
<@U043AB2QT>: will do :smile:
I think I once saw an app that was the perfect solution for this
but I forgot the name and only works in the US
it was a mobile app that had some image recognition so if you snapped a photo of a bill if would just log in a payment
<@U047GTU64>: Crunch have this -> <https://help.crunch.co.uk/customer/portal/articles/2031559-introduction-to-snap>

attachments.title: Introduction to Snap
attachments.text: About Snap Snap has been developed by Crunch in partnership with Receipt Bank to bring you an incredibly easy way t...

text: (Not used it myself...much)
<@U043AB2QT>: had 0 knowledge of it
I’ll probably try to use that now :eyes:
thanks

The thing is though, there is always the step of reconciling that expense and the payment in your account... You need to match them up.... But if your expense already exists (via that snap app), then the reconciliation process in crunch tries to be quite smart and work out which expense a bank statement line item matches to. So if the amount and the dates match you don't really need to do much other than click the "match" button
<@U043AB2QT>: oh I know but that case rarely happens to me even when I’ve reconciled
which bank do you use?
I use barclays and according to CS she always needs to amend their exports here and there

<@U047GTU64>: CS?

I use Cater Allen. The only thing I find I might need to amend is maybe an expense date where it registered a day or so out on my bank statement. Nothing that really gets in my way.

That's my experience anyway
customer support
